title: 496. Do Unions Still Work?
description: Organized labor hasn’t had this much public support in 50 years, and yet the percentage of Americans in a union is near a record low. A.F.L-C.I.O. president Liz Shuler tries to explain this gap — and persuade Stephen Dubner that “the folks who brought you the weekend” still have the leverage to fix a broken economy.
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
